Reviews.Title: “Not for human beings - will close in February 2012”
Reviews.Author: b k
Reviews.Content: I lived here for a year and they only started the improvements to the bathrooms 4 months back which by the way are dirty and smell of pee and the toilets leak...too little too late as its closing next year 2012.Theres no where to smoke or drink beer except a courtyard but its not fit for a dog. Apart from that everything is too much trouble for the staff. Not fit for humans

Reviews.Title: “It made me have a breakdown, it was so horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Nottinghill Carnival and thought it would be good as it was so close to where we wanted to be and so cheap too. The price however, very much reflected the service. It was dank, disgusting and not fit for humans to be in. The room was cramped and had a carpet about a centimetre thick with dirt. The room had a fire door with the mechanism held together with string and electrical tape. The walls were dirty and there was exposed pipes all over the place. The beds were some of the worst I've ever slept in, four inch thick mattresses with springs sticking out all over the place. The only plus point of the whole trip was that it had clean sheets. The bathrooms were the worst bit. Every surface is covered in mould. The showers - if they work at all - trickle out dirty water that makes your hair feel squeaky and weird. The ceilings in the TIIINY bathrooms are just covered, completely covered in aggressive mould. One of the bathrooms had a pipe burst at the back and there was faeces and urine all over the floor. There was also always like an inch of water on the floor and they reeked of dampness and excrement. The owners are lazy idiots too. We reported the state of the shower rooms to them and they were short and unhelpful with us, despite my emotional state. My advice is DO NOT STAY HERE. Go to the Bayswater instead, which is the same price4 roughly, but much, much cleaner and more professional. What this felt like was a building for storing people in the worst conditions. There are also huge rooms with supposed "facilities" which are totally empty. Do not be fooled by what the owners claim to have. There are no toilets worth using, no cooking facilities and the whole place is disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for location”
Reviews.Author: platos33
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here for 2 1/2 weeks and we found it to be a good location (near Paddington, Royal Oak tube around the corner and red bus across road), was close to shops and cafes nearby 5-10 min walk. The room itself was a bit unclean and it looked like the bathroom floor hadn't been mopped in a while, but apart from that the room was quiet and had a microwave and fridge which we used often. Only other downside was for the first week we had hot water whenever we wanted, but during the second week the hot water would come and go and would have to wait for it to return (which was annoying at 11pm at night after a long day). Had to pay for wifi in the room, but found it cheap enough for 1 pound per hour. For the price we paid it was good value, would stay there again, but then again we used it as a base for our day trips in and out of London.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hostel in London”
Reviews.Author: jmrt_86
Reviews.Content: Hi, I'm spanish and I had to go to London for study english for a month. This hostel is very poor, the walls are very very unclean and the toilet too. The beds have a lot of bedbugs and the hostel service was very bad. The kitchen was very unclean too and i had to use a bleach every time we ate. I don't recommend this hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away”
Reviews.Author: CamillaW2
Reviews.Content: The hostel is situated too far away from the city center, especially when you've been doing a lot of shopping. But it IS managable :) The room given, was a private one with twin beds. It was very nice and big, two lockers and ensuite bathroom, and the cleanliness was better than expected. Desk staff was nice, except the kitchen lady, who didnt exactly make you feel welcome. More like hurrying you along as if she had something more important to do than serving us.

Reviews.Title: “excellent surprise”
Reviews.Author: ellieungvari
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room with own bathrom,fridge at kettle! Friendly staff, receptionist extremly helpfull. very low price which included breakfast as well. In the TV room you can socialize with other travellers. Thank you Torquay House!

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hostel”
Reviews.Author: we_are_working_on_it
Reviews.Content: I spent few days in this hostel during the last february with some friends and we all had the same impression: a very good deal!!! For few pounds u get more than u deserve: great location, nice rooms almolst fully equipped, clean with sparkling linen, nice staff...even the breakfast is included... I've been in London more than once and this is the best deal i have got in this expensive city in ages!!! Truly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Evgeni33
Reviews.Content: Very nice hostel with great staffs, who are very helpful and with smiles on their face, which makes customers easier to communicate with them, the price was really affordable for me with good location, close to the center of the city, that's why i met so many nice people from different countries. I enjoyed staying in this hostel and i'm sure that next time i'll come here again, i already recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and value for money”
Reviews.Author: PiperArt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Torquay house on and off for 18 months. Some were better than others I must confess, but overall it wget in a hotas pleasant, warm and friendly. I found the staff particularly friendly and at times quite patient with visitor. At the end of the day It is a HOSTEL, NOT a hotel; therfore it is in a different comparison category. For the price you pay, you get the basics; nothing more. To expect the same service you would in a hotel is stupid. However basic things like hot water and proper showers should be expected. If you expect it to be a very cheap hotel, then you will have a terrible stay. If you see it as a backpackers type hostel, then you will have a better stay. As I said, I had a good time there and i would go back to stay there. I found the staff very friendly and polite, although some patience is needed at times with the levels of English; bearing in mind most of the staff are volunteers and are over here trying to improve their English. I have reccommended this hostel to friends and I know people who conitnue to stay there when in London for business.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Horrible”
Reviews.Author: khums
Reviews.Content: It was really a nightmare ,that I wouldnt want to live it again. I have booked for my stay via the internet , From the pictured from their website I assumed It was a nice place > but It turned out to be a totall mess. I have paid for five nights on my arrival, however I fled away from the second night because I couldnt take It anymore.and they refused to give me a refund for the rest thre days.

Reviews.Title: “torquay maximum security jail”
Reviews.Author: werr
Reviews.Content: torquay hostel is a waste of time. the people they hire they can hardly speak english. while some of the staff were very nice others like the security and a few people that worked at the reception were morons that treated the place like it was a prison and you were not just visiting but one of the convicts. certainly not a family atmosphere. the only reason anyone would go there would be for the location as it is sort of central but that is about it. the neighbourhood to is full of muslims and eastern europeans. if it was english people you thought you meet forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hostel: not worth the cheap price”
Reviews.Author: brebers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hostel because we were having trouble finding reasonably priced hotels or hostels in London that did not require a shared bedroom or bathroom. We saw the pictures on hostelworld.com and decided it looked nice. When we arrived at the Torquay House, we were surprised to see the neighborhood it was in... and upon entering we had to pay the whole sum up front, without even seeing the room. When we got to the room it was freezing cold and the heat didn't work. There were no towels, no soap, and no toilet paper in the room and the whole room was dirty (in the picture you can see the spots on the walls). Furthermore, the neighborhood seemed so unsafe that we didn't feel comfortable walking back at night. Once in our room, we were cold the whole night and woken up numerous times because the sounds from the halls were so loud and the beds (which were essentially futons) were so squeaky. The shower only has warm water (it was not hot) for a few hours everyday and we had to hold the shower head for the entire shower because the hook did not work. In the morning they advertise a continental breakfast which was nothing more than bread (the toaster didn't work) and warm milk, and there was not enough seating for everyone. We were so unhappy and didn't feel unsafe that we decided to leave after one night even though we had paid for three and they would not give us a refund. (We figured out why they make you pay the full price up front). Do not be fooled by the attractive price tag because we ended up paying more anyway since we left for another hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Torquay House
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Torquay Street, London W2 5EJ, England
